question: Question_09_(d)
statement:
Consider the matrix

$A = \begin{bmatrix}
0 & 1& 2 & 3 \\ 
0 & 2& 1 & 3\\ 
0 & 3& 0 & 3\\ 

\end{bmatrix}$

d) Find the dimension of $\text{Null}(A^{T})$
sols:
To find the the dimension of $Null(A^{T})$, we can use the rank-nullity
theorem $dim(N(A^{T})) = n - r(A)$ where n is the number of rows of
matrix A, and r(A) is the rank of matrix A.

so, we have $dim(N(A^{T})) = 3 - 2 =1$

the dimension of $Null(A^{T})$ is therefore 1.
